msItem.title: Akbar-namah.
msItem.note: F1a: Signature of Ellis dated 21.12.20. F274b, at end of text: impression of small oval seal, defaced. Folio following 174, recto, in Ellis's hand: Luzac (Beveridge) 21.12.20. Front flyleaf: a) Note signed H(enry) B(everidge) and dated 30 July 1919, describing the MS. b) At bottom, upside down: H. Beveridge Repaired 1905. Inserted, loose, is a table of contents in Ellis's hand. The first daftar, covering Akbar's early life and the reigns of Babur and Humayun. Headings and punctuation in red. Ruled margins.
msItem.incipit: Allahu Akbar in chih dar-yaftist zharf u shinakhti shigarf

bindingDesc.p: Red leather Indian binding with stamped and painted decoration, the spine an English replacement with tooled title etc.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
